well I need to go, once you download that, just create a file with .bat extension in the same folder as the exe. Open the .bat in text editor and put this in it

Content: @webworker01 while both sprout and sapling addresses are supported, it would be best to phase out sprout addresses sooner than later, for obvious reasons. Maybe just do sprout payments once per day ? some way to incentivize people to switch to a sapling address.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
@webworker01 
I am back today, I think I can make the payment processor work for pirate, sapling should work by just using a sapling address, can have a go at this today. Unless you have it sorted?

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: I think the problem is when there is a mix of sapling and sprout addresses that need to be paid out

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Also, I am happy to do some testing with you. I am trying to get the RKT chain up and running at the moment

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Just had a look at the pool code, and yes that will be the problem.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: My pool should actually work already with the Z-tx that web made for Pirate.... however if that happens, then there will be an issue with the sendmany.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: One way around it is by forcing sapling addresses from the start. Easy for a new pool, not so easy for web and their pool with a lot of people on it currently.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: A small change to the `var getProperAddress` in the payment processor should ensure that the pool won't accept sapling addresses

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: (In web's knomp anyhow)

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yeah ... it seems like you need to have 2 seperate configs... one for sapling address and one for sprout

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and people will need to move over after it activates

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: It is a difficult problem to manage. I think for your pool, you'd be better off forcing sapling addresses from the get go. That way you don't have to worry about sprout

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I dont have a pirate pool... Just wasnt sure if they needed mine for it or not..

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I thaught that my pool didnt work with z-tx payments, but I juts read the code and it looks like it will work just fine.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Yeah I believe snomp has z transaction and shielding in the payment processor as well

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I am testing my pool with an ac_private=1 chain now.. will test just with spaling address's ... and ignore the sprout stuff. It seems like having seperate ports for sprout and sapling will be the only way to do this for pirate.. every other chain works already.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: There is a bunch. VRSC (good for CPU/GPU), ARRR (mostly mined by ASIC's, if you have cheap electricity and a lot of GPU's this could still be profitable), KMD (self explanatory), HUSH. They're just a couple I can think of

Author: JaseOfAllTrades#8229
Content: VRSC. Ah yes, not the first time hearing about this. Will be looking at this as i only have CPU/GPU hardware to mine
